website_summaries.verdict: High power tire pump with comprehensive feature set. Excellent value.
pros: Just set it and press go
Has clear, accurate display and bright LED lights for night use
Tough to beat for the money
cons: Performance on truck tires not as good as expected, but gets the job done

website_summaries.verdict: One of the smallest inflators available on the market. Great for keeping around the car or outside in the garage for emergency use.
pros: An intelligent design allows you to keep all the small parts and accessories with the inflator itself
Multiple adapters will attach to different tires and sports equipment with ease
cons: Auto shutoff doesn't always respond accurately to the current pressure

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome! Works better than the air pumps at the gas station!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! It’s small, portable, light, fills the tires fast and works great! The best part is you type what pressure you want the tire to be inflated to and voila done! One drawback is the cord is a little short but my small crossover SUV has a port in the trunk and in the driver console so I can get all my tires inflated. I highly recommend getting this.
customer_reviews.author: Chipper

customer_reviews.title: Save money and time
customer_reviews.text: Depending on your tires' recommended PSI, this automatic pump could take a few minutes to fill it. It took about a minute and a half to refill my tire, which has a slow-leak, back up to 35 PSI. The machine is also very loud, but that can be expected from any air compressor. Functionally and aesthetically, it works great. I have had a lot of slow leaks over the years and have had to spend money on compressed air at gas stations to refill my tires. Now I can stay at home and refill them for free at my leisure. It's small enough to keep in the corner of my trunk behind my roadside emergency kit.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Plastic parts break easily. Tube leaks.. buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: The electronics seems good and there is a consistency in air flow. Pre-set measurements help with ensuring you do not under or over pump. The biggest con are the plastic and rubber parts. The plastic notch on the tube broke in 3 weeks and then within a month the rubber in the tube cracked; thus rendering it useless. Buyer beware. Manufacturer, if you are listening; please replace or fix the issue and I will revisit this review.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: A lot of power from a small compressor
customer_reviews.text: This machine is really compact, and it is powered from you car's 12V socket. It does a fantastic job of quickly inflating your tires. It has a digital pressure gauge which allows you to preset the desired air pressure, and it will automatically stop when the pressure is reached. It is incredibly quick, taking just seconds to top off your tire pressure. I replaced a broken 120V compressor with the AUDEW model and the AUDEW is much faster, and much less noisy. Well worth the very modest price. I highly recommend the AUDEW Portable Air Compressor Pump.
customer_reviews.author: Dadmc

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working at second use.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this late October 2018, and on the second time using it last week it suddenly stopped working. I was adding air to two tires on my Ford Expedition. I wonder if the one I got was from a bad batch.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew E.

customer_reviews.title: Best pump
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pump I have purchased of different makes. It by far the best: fastest, automatic shutoff to desired pressure, does not use too much current for my older car, can inflate the spare to 90 psi, plus it has a convenient light, carrying case and months later with normal usage, it is just as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco Santori

customer_reviews.title: Loved it when it was working
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few times then nothing; would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This item worked the first time I used it, after that, nothing. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked 4 times and quit
customer_reviews.text: It works for low psi but it failed on me trying to air up Trailer tires at 80psi. Failed after 2 tires. They were at 63 psi so it isnt like they needed air up from 0. I had used this unit a total of 10 times. Nice bells and whistles with the led PSI and the light but failed when I needed it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's fast, lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this AUDEW Portable Air Compressor Pump for over a year now and it hasn't failed me once! I used it often during the last year because I had a tire with a slow leak that I had to re-inflate every time I drove anywhere. It inflated from 8-12 psi to 33 psi in less than 2 minutes. It's easy to store and simple to use. It's a good, reliable little pump and I've been thinking of buying some for my son's cars. Great price, too. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K.O.

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for a couple of months. However 2-3 months later, while using the air pump, the machine started making a loud, strange noise and stopped working. I tried a couple of times after to see if it work again but it continued to make the awful noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great - easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works well. All four of my tires were low when I received this. Simple to operate and clear to read the screen. set the amt of pressure and it does its thing. The description says the cord will reach truck tires.. I dont know, if it says so.. I have a Honda Fit and felt like it just reached for me. One note, good luck getting the cord looped back around and into the notches. Thankfully it comes in a small storage bag. no more running all over town when my air gets low!
customer_reviews.author: shershey

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: The unit works as advertised. I have no complaints. Although I did break one, only because I wasn't paying attention. I own a 25' AirStream that requires 80PSI per tire. Filling two from my routine is about what I can do without letting it cool down. I broke one because I did the fourth, and it was smoking hot. So now, I fill one do something else, fill the second, do something else. Check for temperature before I do the 3rd and 4th. I love the fact that it shuts off at the desired pressure. Also keep in mind, double check with an analog pressure gauge so you know where the digital stands. Safety first!
customer_reviews.author: CazuaL6

customer_reviews.title: Works and is small
customer_reviews.text: Works and is small. Does not take up much space in my Vette. Air hose is not that long... I have to roll my wheel until stem is by the ground because I don't hold it while filling. I plug it in power and just set the pressure on the display, then I turn it on and set it on the ground as it fills the tire. It adds a few pounds within a minute. Power cord is plenty long enough. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: dp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and useful
customer_reviews.text: Tire pressure changes with the cold so I was always getting a warning that my tire pressure is low. This compressor allows you to set the pressure your tires should be at and automatically fills them to that pressure. It is easy. I did it and the warnings have stopped and when they reoccur the solution is easy. Just attach the pump and fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Reads

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t use it more than once!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use it only one time!!! Don’t know what happened but it didn’t work!
customer_reviews.author: Diego tavarez

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to use, I spend a lot of time and very noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Handy and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product! The size is handy even for my small hands! Convenient for keeping in the vehicle! Purchased as a gift for my brother in law who is constantly hauling motorcycles and ATVs in his trailer! This is perfect for airing up bike or trailer tires when needed on the go! It's fairly lightweight and the cord is long as well! Several accessories were included including a needle for airing up balls! Overall a great product at a good price! Arrived right on time and exactly as described!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Super Small and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I used to be constantly scolded by my spouse for having low tires until I bought this. It’s fairly small and iseasy to store in a small trunk or anywhere in a garage.
customer_reviews.author: Dominiquemb

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and breaks quickly
customer_reviews.text: This product is a complete waste of money. It completely broke after 2 uses. I would highly recommend AGAINST buying this
customer_reviews.author: Kara Krushel

customer_reviews.title: Great item to keep in your car for emergencies...
customer_reviews.text: With the TPS (Tire Pressure Sensors), every time there is a dramatic cooling in the weather I get a warning light on my dashboard advising me of low pressure. Having this unit helps me eliminate that warning light, and assures me that I'm not wasting fuel or jeopardizing my safety with low pressure in my tires.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence R. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS CRAP!!!
customer_reviews.text: Update: The manufacturer refuses to honor their 1 year warranty, instead referring me to amazon’s return policy which is only 30 days after purchase. DO NOT PURCHASE ANYTHING FROM THIS MANUFACTURER!!! After almost a year and maybe 3 uses, today the hose exploded and came out of the compressor case while I was pulled over on the side of the interstate trying to air up a tire. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: DRGW SD40T-2

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Set the pressure you want in the tire and turn it on. It shuts off automatically and is accurate. Has a place to store the fill hose and power cord, plus come with a case. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: dynamos

customer_reviews.title: Worked Like A Champ!
customer_reviews.text: Came just in time. One of my tires decided to pick up a screw, so I used it twice before I could get the tire fixed. Worked great. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: jayhix07

customer_reviews.title: My Opinion
customer_reviews.text: So I got this item because one day I noticed the wheel on my driver's side was low. Thankfully my co-worker had a portable air compresser, which gave me the idea to get one. This air compressor does a great job at filling my tire. It's not too big and the cord is very long so filling any tire is no problem. The only issue I could say is that I wish the instruction manual was more helpful. I've been successful at just guessing what the R button is supposed to do but it was a tad confusing the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Britney S.

customer_reviews.title: Good While It Lasted...
customer_reviews.text: Good while it lasted but it stopped working after only a couple uses. The unit suddenly stopped working shortly after the amazon return period expired. Very disappointing. Save your money and buy a better quality compressor...
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: 0 stars! This product worked the first time I used it and then this year when I pulled it out to use it, the chuck won't close on the tire stem and air leaks out. The reason I say 0 stars is because I reached out to the company who have an automatic message saying they will get back in 1 business day and they didn't, nor the next day so I sent an email. No response. No I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy N.

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Blah. Eh.
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge fan of this item. It's small, loud (relatively speaking), under-powered, and very unpolished / rough around the edges so to say. As a true compressor or tire inflation tool it leaves much to be desired and is not recommended in any way. There are countless better options. Get a real, true air compressor. As an emergency compressor to keep in a vehicle [for emergencies!] it's a respectable way to get peace of mind. To top off just a few psi on tires when seasons change, it's a reasonable option. To inflate bike tires, balls, etc., it's a handy tool. Know the practical limitations and use it appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: M&N

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Received the baby, I need to pump design and chic, small and exquisite, with several times, the air soon, the small voice really very small, I am very satisfied with my very satisfied, baby is better than my imagination, had to Shanghai some praise, next time I buy again, when the time comes to trouble the shopkeeper give a big discount greatly discount.
customer_reviews.author: Julie O.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This air pump is great I do Uber/Lyft so my time is very limited I don't have time to sit in a line waiting to pay $1.50 to for 3mins to pump up my tires, but with this tool it saves me time and money. If my tire is going low in the middle of no where I have a way to pump it up.
customer_reviews.author: Wade D. Morings Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should carry one of these
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband several years ago. We have not had a need to use it until yesterday. A gentleman on a parking lot had a flat tire (totally on the rim flat) and no spare. I suggested we give this pump a try, put enough air in it to get him to a repair shop. I could not believe how quickly this little pump inflated that tire. Several passersby stopped and were as surprised as I was. It's small takes up very little space, has digital read out, stops automatically when reaches the required # per tire. I'm getting one for our other car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago. Today the hose tore by the connector so it is now useless. This one was extremely difficult to put on and take off. And once you got it on, you couldn’t get it off. It’s like the rubber seal inside the connector was way to small. I struggled with it every time I had use it. Probably why the hose tore as well, I don’t know. Other than that, it was easy to use and performed well, I liked the carry case that came with it. This one is not so good, I’m going to buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: mulfo4444

customer_reviews.title: Saved me
customer_reviews.text: This is been the most handy thing I’ve had for my car since my portable jump starter , this thing has personally saved me money and reinflated my tires in dire situations at least four times since I bought it , it does not work for anything bigger than 30 as I tried it with my work van. Did not work, but I got it for my car so that’s perfectly fine everyone should buy this and keep it handy in their car so you won’t need to go to a gas station if the worst were to happen
customer_reviews.author: LMB

customer_reviews.title: Works about 10 times on all four tires, but then...
customer_reviews.text: the rubber in the valve stem pinch connector goes bad. I see the rubber is made of a very cheap and worthless rubber that cannot handle being exposed to the cold since that is when it was most needed for me. The device pumped air into tires just fine when the connector was only used a couple of times. If this connector could be repaired or replaced I would reconsider my rating. The pump worked but the stem connector went bad really fast so my rating is one star.
customer_reviews.author: NoTW[NotofThisWorld]

customer_reviews.title: Small size, fast inflation, not noisy
customer_reviews.text: I have used two from AutoZone. This one is not noisy compared with others. The size is small enough to put in glove box. It inflates pretty fast given the size. It is easy to put on and start. Even my wife can handle it easily.
customer_reviews.author: GinoZK

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: I have used this many times since I bought it; probably around 25 times or so. I use it for my cars and my motorcycle. The only things I don't like are: 1. It's slow 2. The cord doesn't store nicely. There is a place on the back of the device for the cord. But it doesn't realistically fit the entire cord. I gave up trying to wrap it around the little holders and just stuff it into the bag behind the pump.
customer_reviews.author: GWS

customer_reviews.title: Portable and it works so far...
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in the car and primarily use it to fill up my bicycle tires. They are tires which take from 80 to 110 psi. I run them at 100 psi most of the time. I also like the fact that I can air up the car tires without going to a gas station or car wash etc.... and use the beat up air pumps you wait in line for and pay money only to realize the damn thing works half a$$ at best....haha Anyways hopeful this air pump will last me a while. So far it works fine and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: SomeoneWhobuysStuffTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Meh!
customer_reviews.text: Purchase for family sedans. Awkward learning curve(1). can't just inflate - have to "set" the desired PSI. Cumbersome cause have vehicles with differing front / rear PSI specs. (2). have to wait for pump to "sense" current PSI - then press ON switch. (3). extension cord barely long enough for a pickup truck. (4). slow inflation . . 2 minutes to raise PSI 1/2 pound. (5). broke 1 1/2 years. (6). I do LIKE carry case to hold everything.
customer_reviews.author: Gtr-Man

customer_reviews.title: Great product - a must have
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I got it to keep in my car in case of emergency as well as if I needed to quickly add a little air at the change of seasons. Great accuracy and easy to use. I love that you just turn it on and it stops once it reaches the desired pressure. No guessing and no need to keep checking with a tire gauge. I now have got one for each car in our family and even bought one for our Yankee Swap at work.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Great for truck air bags
customer_reviews.text: Wow great little pump for pumping up airbags on a truck works really good. I want to look at my order where I paid 17.99 for this item and I see now that it's 27.99. Wow what a price increase in almost overnight. I guess the seller can sell less and make as much as the American dream. But overall it's a great little handheld compressor I don't know if with pump up tires very fast but like I said it does a wonderful job on the airbags.
customer_reviews.author: Donald A. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Audew Tire Inflator
customer_reviews.text: Update: review fraud alert. This company launched a completely new product and just carried over reviews from the old product. Rating updated to one star for the fraud! Unit works fine and is reasonably priced. What I don’t like is it doesn’t store well on your bike or car because of how the hose shoots out the front. It would be easy to damage it also. The Airman inflator is a couple bucks more, but all the connectors, power cord and hose are protected and self contained in its compact package, making it much more convenient to store.
customer_reviews.author: TRUMP 2020

customer_reviews.title: Works great for standard cars
customer_reviews.text: Nice little unit. I'm not sure I'd recommend this if you have large, truck-type tires. It took over 5 minutes to raise the air pressure 5 PSI in my Ford F-150 tire. The unit was starting to get very warm, so I filled this tire in two steps, with 10 minutes in between to let the unit cool down. On my car, that same 5 PSI only took a few minutes. I like that it's a screw-on connector, so you can attach it, set the desired PSI, turn it on and not have to sit there babysitting it.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: For emergencies to have a car pump
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item because this summer our son had a flat tire and the spare was flat also. He loaned his car pump out and did not have it. So it spurred us to get one to Carry in our car for emergencies like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Tapp

customer_reviews.title: WORKING +1 YEAR BUT DIFFICULT TO USE
customer_reviews.text: It has lasted longer than a year, it pumps air, and is close to accurate.... BUT you will fight to get the nozzle fitting on a tire valve or off a tire valve each and every time. Its extremely difficult. Thus, wasting time and tearing up your fingers. It's a constant challenge to get this seated onto a valve and locked down -- then its painful to try and remove it once you have aired the tire. I have used this to fill bike tires, car tires, and motorcycle tires. ALWAYS the same issue. A friend of mine has one also -- has the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Crunch

customer_reviews.title: Works Great For Bike, Car & ATV Tires NOT So Much On 35" Truck Tires
customer_reviews.text: I have had this air compressor in my truck for over a year and used it very sparingly, mainly balls, bikes and atv tires maybe total use of 5 times but when I needed it most it showed it's true quality. Had a screw in my rear tire (very slow leak) on my Ram 2500 and needed to inflate the tire from 58 psi to 70 psi to get through the morning appointments to get to the tire shop. It took 20 minutes to add 12 psi to a 295-65R 20 tire and was smoking like crazy when it finally got finished. Would NOT recommend this product, typical imported JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.author: Larry N.

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: This product is one of those that you don't realize you need until you buy it, then you wonder how you lived without it. Has been a life saver for me to blow up trailer tires without having to change tires. Have used it on my horse trailer when I couldn't use an electric pump. I had to park my truck next to horse trailer in field to reach the wheels, but it made it much easier for me
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great, light, and portable.
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of using the machines at the gas station that require $1.50 in quarters. This works exceptionally for the tires on cars. I use a handheld device to measure the tire pressure after pumping it up to the appropriate PSI and it’s within 0.1-0.3 PSI of the setting, I.e. 31.8 PSI when set to 32 PSI. Would recommend just for the convenience of pumping air in tires at home before starting the car up to drive to a gas station.
customer_reviews.author: HerroGoodbye

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump for your car
customer_reviews.text: I was at first skeptical because the pump itself is plastic not sure which kind of plastic, but after using it like the directions say it pumped my 2013 BMW 320i tires no problem all the while being able to use the 12-volt connection's. Thing's that i like are the max tire pressure setting's so you don't go over like when your at the gas station's and also i like that the cord will reach just far enough on a mid sized SUV , like my Honda Pilot.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, filled the tire in a decent amount of time. I bought the other types of compressors that sit on the ground and made a lot of noise. This is better and even my wife likes using it.
customer_reviews.author: john a walker jr

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Air Line
customer_reviews.text: This pump did not even last a year. The design on the tube that pushed the air into tire leaks. The connector that attaches the air line with the connector that attaches to the tire started leaking. Everytime you put the compressor away and attach the air line back into its stored position it seem like it pushed the tube and the metal connector away from each other, so now it leaks. Did not even last a couple of months. They need to update the design to give the tube more slack when it is attached back into storage.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Beats going to the gas station.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the air pump at the end of 2017 and it is still going good. I use it for my car tires whenever they need air. It's easy to use. You just enter the desired air pressure weight and then hit the on switch and the pump will fill air to the desired weight.
customer_reviews.author: CloseCut

customer_reviews.title: better than the walmart one
customer_reviews.text: I had a rechargeable one from Walmart that seemed really convenient but didn't really last. The pipe stopped pumping air just after a few times of use. Aside from the quality, it wasn't that convenient because once the battery is out, you can't do anything with it until a few hours of charge. Now I got this one which I never have to worry about running out of battery. And the quality of it has been great so far. The meter is awesome, as long as you set the PSI up, it tells itself when to stop. So I can just plug it in and do something else while waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Great pump, this was my 2nd purchase
customer_reviews.text: I really like that you can set up the PSI then walk away while it works. I usually add 1-1.5 PSI as I always lose some air when taking the connector off. My only complaint is minor in that there is no way to turn the light off. I usually use this in a well lit garage and I always forget the flashlight part is on and blind myself when removing it from the tire. This is my 2nd purchase to keep in the trunk of the 2nd car as I liked the first one so much. I even had the neighbor buy one after I used this to pump his tires.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: This is no good!
customer_reviews.text: Well I bought this thing in December and left it in the box and put it under the seat of my utv for emergencies. Well I finally pulled it out today in May to test it out and it stinks! I followed the instructions. But it will only air up one PSI at a time. Your supposed to be able to put in a number and it stops when you get to it. You have to shut it off and turn it back on for it to air up one more PSI. I know I should have tested this out when I got it but I didn’t. So now I’m out $ and I need to buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I really like this tire inflator
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say. I didn't think it was going to work as well it did. It seemed awfully small in comparison to other ones that I've used the past, however, it worked and it worked damn well. I just so happened to have low tire pressure from the drop in temperature outside. So I pulled this bad boy out, screwed it on to the tire valve told it what pressure to set it to, and let it do it the thing. It was simply easy.
customer_reviews.author: Marjory Robert

customer_reviews.title: Set and walk away
customer_reviews.text: I have had a slow leak in one of my tires for the longest time and need to inflate every couple weeks. This thing is great because I can set it and zone off for a couple minutes knowing that it will stop when it hits the right PSI. It's small and fits conveniently in the corner of my trunk, not taking valuable space. I also like that it came with all the attachments that I need to inflate the various athletic balls around my house.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Markzon

customer_reviews.title: Buy this you wont regret it
customer_reviews.text: So worth having in the car with me. In the winter time the pressure seems to get low in my car often. All I have to do is pull over, plug in and within moments I'm back on the road. Good to have when you travel and you arent near a gas station. Then you have to scrounge for some quarters to use their air pump that more than likely doesnt work right.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Just like a flat tire, you never know when this will quit on you
customer_reviews.text: Pros: compact, price, ease of use, practical Cons: durability. I’ve only had this 19 months. Used it maybe a just as much. Pulled it out to use it the other day and nothing. No power. No lights, nothing. I bought pump from autozone before this one and it lasted me 20+ years. Only reason I bought this one was because the autozone ones power switch became faulty. Quality and durability is just not there with this one. But for $36-38 I really can’t complain too much about it.
customer_reviews.author: Dubdout

customer_reviews.title: Good product, 8 months later, pump head is failing
customer_reviews.text: The pump works well, pretty quick inflation, auto shut off, long cord. BUT, now the pump head actually lets air OUT of the tire as soon as I attach it to the valve. I have to hold it on the valve, then switch on the pump and continue to press the pump head onto the valve while it inflates. As soon as the compressor shuts off, I quickly remove the pump head so no air is lost due to the faulty head. In fact, I set the automatic gauge to a full pound higher than my tires require to compensate for the lost air.
customer_reviews.author: Bikergram

customer_reviews.title: Even I, who isn't mechanically minded, could figure this out!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE,LOVE,LOVE!! I didn't want to be stranded somewhere with a flat tire without having my car stocked with needed equipment. I watched a video I found online, and it was very simple to operate. I ordered 2 more of these (I may have already given a review of this-but that's how much I like it) for my college aged students to keep in their cars. I would highly recommend! It'd be nice if it was a little less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Truffles

customer_reviews.title: Instructions could be a little clearer
customer_reviews.text: I love the convenience of having this little guy in my trunk. However, I had a low tire and it was late at night. The instructions presume that you know what you'r3 doing and the nuances of the gadget. I didn't. I found the pressure gage numbers tended to jump unless it the valve was perfect and filling the tire was an exercise in uncertainty. Works but I recommend a few practice runs before hitting the open road.
customer_reviews.author: KellyC

customer_reviews.title: Better to have & not need then need & not have.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely can be a life saver when you have an emergency flat. I had a really low tire out of state on a weekend trip. Didn’t have any sort of air compressor so I was stopping probably every 30min to put air in my tire, It was a serious pain. I bought this to better prepared for an emergency. This comes in a bag which is nice to hold everything in one bag and I put in my trunk compartment because it’s nice and compact as well.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Flota

customer_reviews.title: It worked but my application was a challenge.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked but needs a straight push on valve and not the 90 degree one they have. The reason being, the angle on my tire stem valves and the shortness of the stem valve length. I had to bend the units 90 degree fill valve to accommodate and the result was that 90 degree valve and tube began to leak air.
customer_reviews.author: jami rose

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy, gets extremely hot after 1 tire.
customer_reviews.text: The portable compressor is really convenient, doesn't take up any room. It's extremely quick and easy to use. I could only air up 1 tire at a time. Tire pressure was at 31psi and filled it to 35psi. After automatic shut off at the correct pressure that I preset, the compressor was incredibly hot and surprised it didn't catch fire. The outside temp was 74°F with a slight breeze. I still have 3 more tires but going to wait until tomorrow. Maybe I can do 1 a day, unless it is already burnt out. If you have a full size truck with extended cab and a long bed, the cord is about a foot to short. Story of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Raeber

customer_reviews.title: Puting air in a tire couldnt be easier
customer_reviews.text: I love this little gadget, i have used it several times, easy to use, shuts off automatically when tire reaches proper pressure. Easy instructions to operate and can even watch instruction video on youtube. Puting air in a tire has never been easier! I bought one to keep in each of my cars.
customer_reviews.author: rrred lips

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product 👍
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t disappointed. It has some weight to it and feels like a very solidly built tool. The screen is sharp and brightly lit. Pressure needed is easily set. I also like that it has a screw-on fitting instead of a clamp making it easier to use on a motorcycle. The LED light on the front is a nice feature as we. I like to recommend this product to everyone:)))
customer_reviews.author: Andy Z

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.  Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for in case I needed it during our roadtrip to Alaska 1 year ago. Luckily I didn't have to use it in the middle of nowhere in Alaska. Now, when one of my car tires had a nail and tire pressure was low, I tried to use this air pump and it didn't work. It somewhat worked when I lifted it up sideways, and it stopped. Recommend: Do not buy this product. It was a waste of money. I wish I can get my refund. I bought another one from Costco and that worked well right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: CoolDude

customer_reviews.title: Portable air pump in the car
customer_reviews.text: I was getting so tired of going to the local gas station to only find out that the air pumps were broken. Seems like in the winter, it happens more often than not. Pros + plugs into the car, extremely travel ready + Comes with adaptors for other uses + price was a good point Cons - it would have been nice if it came with a travel case - none now, let's see how it holds up over time
customer_reviews.author: Todd Yolish

customer_reviews.title: Failed me when I needed it most
customer_reviews.text: Didn't need this for 3 years, when I did I realized the pin on the piece that connects to the valve stem was misaligned so I couldn't even connect it to my tire. Major bummer
customer_reviews.author: Austin Barber

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: So, this pump not only fails to inflate my car tire, but it also can't inflate the kids bike tires. Complete waste of money. Avoid this like the Covid-19 virus.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without this!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from a recommendation from a friend who keeps this in his car. Not only do I now use this for my tires on road trips I also use it for my golf carts which I am in the biz of. Thanks for offering a great product. It's small, works perfectly, not difficult at all as instructions are really simple.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra D. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last
customer_reviews.text: It hasnt been a year yet. I only used it about 3-4 times since I bought it in Nov. it was good at first, fast, easy to use, easy to pack. Then this week my tires went low and i used it. I only got reading of 5.0 or 6.0 which isnt accurate. Didnt think to check it cause it’s been barely used. Then my pressure went low again and I thought the pressure symbol is wrong. I tried again this morning. Guess what, the cord is split open!! Most of the times it sits in my trunk. I used it 4 times at most and now it’s useless
customer_reviews.author: Minah Quach

customer_reviews.title: Air for your tires
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time since I purchased it last week. It was so easy to use and put air in my car tire. It’s great to have and keep in the trunk, you never no when you’ll get the tire pressure notification on your dash. This will keep you from trying to find a gas station and paying for air. It’s definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Great portable compressor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wifes car. Tested the unit, looks well made. Easy to use. Comes with a nice little bag for storing. Now lives in her trunk for any roadside emergency she may have. May buy one for my adult daughter too. Thanks,
customer_reviews.author: Carolina_Kipper

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: This has came in handy for a few years now for me and my husband. he had a slow leak in his tire and it was so convenient to air it up wherever we were rather than driving to the gas station for air. We have also helped out a few people. Also has worked with our football and bicycle tires.
customer_reviews.author: Erica E.

customer_reviews.title: All plastic construction with innacurate gauge.
customer_reviews.text: Sure it's cute, but the readings are off by around 4 psi. I've accidentally gotten the light to turn on, but please don't ask me how. The case is 110% plastic, and there's something rattling around on the inside too. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff J

customer_reviews.title: easy to work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to blow up my childs inflatable pool for this sumner. It only took about 5 minutes and it was done. Super easy and it saved me from getting lightheaded from blowing so much lol. Definitely worth the money if you like the little things in life
customer_reviews.author: Julia Windon

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and effective!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for emergencies and it has def helped out many times! I've even helped several coworkers. Good price and would highly recommend to keep for emergencies. It is compact and does not take up any space. The other day my truck tire was flat with only 8 lbs of pressure. It took a minute but it brought it up to 43 lbs
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, light weight. Just follow the directions that come with the compressor. Excellent for travel. Great for inflating everything!! Check the whats in Amazon's description. Watch the video as well....educational. I would never been without it again, and the Price point you can own one for each vehicle. This little Compressor Pump is Terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Morrow

customer_reviews.title: pump head start to leak after around 6 usages
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stuff one year ago and didn't use it too much. However, after I used it some times around 6 times, the pump head is leaking. Tried to fix it however there is no replacement in Amazon. As the hose is part of the stuff and hence the pump head is not replaceable. It's a good thing for emergency usage, however the quality is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at how well it worked
customer_reviews.text: I arrived at my car in the morning to find a flat tires. I tried this device for the first time and was surprised that it pumped up the tire to 30lbs in just a minute or two and I was able to drive my car to a service station to have it repaired.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD B

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes takes a little while (a couple minutes) for this little pump to get the job done, but no sweat, it will fill just about anything, and shut off automatically. Works off the 12v cigarette lighter socket so good for use on the road as well as at home for topping off car tires, bicycles, etc. Pressure readings when done agree well with a good quality pressure gauge.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brewster

customer_reviews.title: Product never even turned on
customer_reviews.text: This picture is not what I received. I didn’t use right away as I had no need for it. Just wanted to order and have in case I had a flat tire. Finally had a flat tire and was eager to try this and this did not even turn on!!! I know I didn’t pay much but I atleast expected it to turn on! I charged it for 1 full day and nothing! Don’t spend your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: YesOnd

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this September of 2018 and today it died on me. This was the first time I had any issues with it too. Used it in the early afternoon and when I went to use it again this evening it wouldn’t push any air, only the light would turn on. I only used it a dozen times in the last year so this is pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: beege0328

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!  Nylon rope infiltrator failed after using it a couple times
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in this item. I used it maybe 3-4 times and the nylon rope that connects to the tire broke and all the air releases out making inflating tires impossible. Had to throw it away and bought one with a RUBBER hose.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Brady

customer_reviews.title: Great for the car. Tube / broke within 1-2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Was good for a few years of occasional use. The hose developed a hole near the top of the braided tube so it stopped working after that. Tape didn't help. Not sure why the hose failed over time with proper storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jedi Master

customer_reviews.title: It was “ok” while it lasted. Won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it was nice. My only complaint is that I had to really wrestle with it every time I wanted to use it to get it secured over the stem of the tire to be inflated. It finally succumbed to use and no longer seals over the stem and is now useless, forcing me to buy another. I won’t be buying one of these again.
customer_reviews.author: Zathrak

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised. Best handheld compressor.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly suprised by how well this works. It works a lot better than one that I have that sits on the ground. I had to set the auto psi setting 3 or 4 higher than what I needed because it wouldn't calculate the psi right. But other than that it's amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy Andy

customer_reviews.title: Did
customer_reviews.text: The item I got did not remotely look like this image...it looked more smaller and like a drill gun....but I thought it was cool and it worked great, twice, then when I needed it most it just wouldn't turn on....
customer_reviews.author: Bri Lo

customer_reviews.title: Nice While It Lasted
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to have the AUDEW tire inflator and used it regularly. But this morning, after 1.5 years the hose sprung a leak and no longer works. Not bad for the price, but there might be a longer lasting competitor out there.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cordes

customer_reviews.title: I'd suggest having one for every household.
customer_reviews.text: My tire has a nail in it and a slow leak. I bought this because I feel like it's a good thing to have in case something happens... well, it works great. I was able to use it for a couple days until I was able to replace my tire. Im not the most mechanically knowledgeable person, but this was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: John Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the mowing Crew!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my landscaping business mowing crew, it works great airing up the tires on the lawnmowers, you’re constantly needing to check tires and make sure the pressure is correct, this does the job plug it up let it do its work you’re on your way! Pretty fast for its size!
customer_reviews.author: Darrell W.

customer_reviews.title: Works until it Doesnt
customer_reviews.text: Its was awesome until it wasnt. Lasted 2 years used it maybe 7 or 8 times to inflate feom 22-25 to 33-36 On my SUV. I got 3 tires done and the 4 motor started rattling and jumping and stopped creating air guess seals went out?
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this for about a year now. Used it a couple of times and it worked well. Tried to use it today and the valve is broken. I made it work enough by holding the tube together so my tire would get me to a gas station but now I’m going to throw it away and get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Very Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is genius. Love it. It works very well. Its lightweight. It's not too noisy. Way better than taking your car to a gas station to fill the air in the tires. It gauges your air pressure and stops everytime it reaches that point. So you cannot over fill your tires.
customer_reviews.author: Travis.R

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Good value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple tires that have slow leaks and bought this air compressor to make my life easier. It works very well. I love the fact that it plugs into my cigarette lighter. I do wish that the cord was a bit longer. I have a minivan and it just reaches the back wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Initially I thought it was a great buy but after only having it a month the part that plugs into the cigarette lighter fell completely apart which was very disturbing considering I have a slow leak in one of my tires and I have to put air daily. I will not recommend anyone else to purchase this product. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Shaneisha Millender

customer_reviews.title: Broken on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Not working on arrival. Bought the same model for my daughter several months ago and it worked well. Wanted one for my own vehicle but took it out to use it this week and it is malfunctioning.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: The product simply didn't work. I plug it into the cigarette lighter, hook it up to the car. It reads a PSI reading for the tire (but its not accurate based on what the car system is telling me) and then set the PSI to what I want and it sometimes inflates for a one second and says it hit the PSI for the car. Disconnect and reconnect and does the same thing. The last time I used it, I almost couldn't get the connector to disconnect from the valve stem and was leaking air the entire time. I lost PSI when trying to use it. Threw it away and wont by another.
customer_reviews.author: Bmost88

customer_reviews.title: Great little buy
customer_reviews.text: Very useful and works as advertise. Nice feature: Once you set the desired air pressure, you just turn it off/on and it will air up the tire until it his that measurement and will automatically shut off. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A Warren

product_meta.title: Audew Portable Air Compressor Pump, Auto Digital Tire Inflator, 12V 150 PSI Tire Pump for Car, Truck, Bicycle, and Other Inflatables
feature_bullets: ✔【Automatically Shut Off 】 - Simply set your desired pressure with Audew air compressor then press the " on button , it will automatically shut off when the proper tire pressure is reached.

✔【 Digital LED Display 】- Audew tire inflator with backlight digital display , certified accurate calibrated to ANSI B40 . 1 International Accuracy Standards ( + 2 % ) , ensuring precise tire pressure readings.

✔【LED Lights 】 -audew digital tire pump is equipped with bright and long-lasting LED lights , easy to use even in the dark , so you can see clearly while you're inflating your tire at night or making quick repairs on a dark lonely country road.

✔【multi-purpose 】- With 10ft long power cord , Audew air pun allows to reach all tires of your car , SUV , bike , motorcycle . Also equipped with 3 nozzle adaptors for mattresses / airboat / toys / sports balls / inflatables.
✔【 space-saving 】 -audew tire inflator with portable compact design makes it easy to lift , easy to carry around , keep this mini air compressor in your trunk , use it anytime you need.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars949 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
